cons: Low salary, understaffed, overworked. Raises are not merit-based as they should be.

pros: William Carey University is a Caring Christian work environment. From the Professors, to the staff, and students, everyone is helpful. I am offered the opportunity to manage my time how I see fit, and to decide which research projects I work on.
cons: I do feel slightly disconnected from the administration. Salary raises seem to be few and far between. There is not much opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: Very easy going job, nice coworkers and supervisors, good job for students
Lots of time off without using PTO
cons: Terribly disorganized structure and low pay for expectations
Outdated administration policies bog down experience

job_title: Associate Professor of Pharmacy Practice in Biloxi, MS
pros: family-friendly, good technology and support services.
cons: low salary/benefits, religious/conservative organization, rural location

pros:

cons:

pros: Great colleagues. Fair pay. Challenging, engaging job. Freedom to pursue many projects.
cons: Extremely disorganized. Old technology. Poor interdepartmental communication.

pros: Great faculty support and positive environment
cons: I do not have any at this time

pros: Great, fair, and positive place to work

good, hard-working students, small classes, congenial faculty, highly motivated colleagues

pleasant working environment, socially conscious administration, well-maintained campus
cons: heavy teaching loads, poor salary, ancient facilities, lacking modern instrumentation, large enrollments in laboratories, very conservative administration, administration could be overbearing, little or no travel funds, too much money is directed toward athletics

review_title: Your experience depends on which department you work with.
job_title: Work Study Student in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: They work around your school schedule, it's a reliable source of income, you're guaranteed most of the holidays off, and many of the work-study supervisors and co-workers are wonderful people to work with!
cons: Not many opportunities for advancement, and there's no way to report mistreatment (if it does happen) without immediate backlash.

review_title: Great work environment if you can afford lower pay
pros: Great colleagues who enjoy each other.  Fantastic environment for students (and worried parents) with professors that really care about the students.  Freedom to explore and initiate new programs exist.
cons: Pay is lower than many larger or public institutions.
